qas.question: What is recommended for email transmission of Unicode?

answers.text: the UTF-8 character set and the Base64 or the Quoted-printable transfer encoding

qas.question: Where are the details of the two mechanisms for email transmission specified?
How many different mechanisms does MIME define for encoding Unicode in email?
How many ways can ASCII characters be encoded in an email?
What is another way to refer to the text body?
What specifications are visible to the user?

context: MIME defines <a2_0><b3_0>two<b3_0/> different mechanisms<a2_0/> for encoding non-ASCII characters in email, depending on whether the characters are in email headers (such as the "<b4_0>Subject:<b4_0/>"), or in the text body of the message; in both cases, the original character set is identified as well as a transfer encoding. For <b6_0>email transmission<b6_0/> of Unicode <a0_0>the UTF-8 character set and the Base64 or the Quoted-printable transfer encoding<a0_0/> are recommended, depending on whether much of the message consists of ASCII-characters. The details of the two different mechanisms are specified in the <a1_0><b5_0>MIME standards<b5_0/><a1_0/> and generally are hidden from users of email software.
